se.bricole.xss.server
Class ClientProxy

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--se.bricole.xss.server.ClientProxy
public class ClientProxy
extends java.lang.Object

The ClientProxy object acts as the gateway between clients. The only way to get a reference to another client is through the ClientProxy object.

The server may keep a number of ClientProxy objects, each of which are handling a number of clients. A client associated with certain ClientProxy can not access clients within other ClientProxy objects. This is a way to isolate groups of clients in order to limit both client and server bandwidth requirements (especially in case of many broadcasts, such has chat rooms).

Method Detail

addSharedObject

public void addSharedObject(java.lang.Object key,
                            java.lang.Object value)

The methods addSharedObject() and getSharedObject() provides a way of sharing objects among clients in a ClientProxy. The functionality is basically that of a Hashtable or HashMap.

Parameters:
key - the hash key
value - the hash value

getSharedObject

public java.lang.Object getSharedObject(java.lang.Object key)

The methods addSharedObject() and getSharedObject() provides a way of sharing objects among clients in a ClientProxy. The functionality is basically that of a Hashtable or HashMap.

Parameters:
key - the hash key

broadcast

public void broadcast(ClientSession source,
                      java.lang.String s)
Sends a broadcast message s to all clients that belongs to this ClientProxy whose receiveBroadcasts property is set to true.

Parameters:
source - the ClientConnection object of the sender
s - the string to broadcast

broadcast

public void broadcast(ClientSession source,
                      java.lang.String s,
                      boolean override)

Broadcasts a message to all clients that belongs to this ClientProxy. The override parameter whether to honour the the receiveBroadcasts property of clients' ClientConnection object

Parameters:
source - the ClientConnection object which the message is originating from
s - the string to broadcast
override - if true, the receiveBroadcasts property of the clients' is not honoured.

serverBroadcast

public void serverBroadcast(ClientSession source,
                            java.lang.String s,
                            boolean override)
Broadcast message "s" originating from "source" to _all_ clients. If "override" is true, all clients will receive the message, regardless of the connections' "receiveBroadcasts" property. If the server is heavily loaded, use this method with care.
